name: Chicken Breast
desc: A lean cut of chicken from the pectoral muscle on the underside of the chicken. A popular source of protein.

name: Broccoli
desc: A green vegetable with a tree-like head, rich in vitamins, minerals, and fiber.

name: Brown Rice
desc: Whole-grain rice with the bran and germ intact, offering more fiber and nutrients than white rice.

name: Olive Oil
desc: A liquid fat obtained from olives, widely used in cooking and known for its healthy monounsaturated fats.

name: Spinach
desc: A leafy green vegetable high in iron and vitamins A and K.

name: Salmon
desc: An oily fish known for its high-quality protein and omega-3 fatty acids.

name: Sweet Potato
desc: A starchy, sweet-tasting root vegetable that is a good source of fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.

name: Eggs
desc: A versatile food source of high-quality protein and healthy fats.

name: Oats
desc: A whole-grain cereal food, often eaten as oatmeal, known for its soluble fiber (beta-glucan).

name: Greek Yogurt
desc: A strained yogurt that is rich in protein and probiotics, with a thick, creamy consistency.

name: Lentils
desc: An edible legume, a good source of plant-based protein, fiber, and various minerals.

name: Avocado
desc: A fruit with a large pit and a creamy texture, rich in healthy monounsaturated fats and fiber.

name: Almonds
desc: A popular nut, a good source of healthy fats, protein, vitamin E, and magnesium.

name: Quinoa
desc: A gluten-free grain that is a complete protein, containing all nine essential amino acids.
